# f5xc_workload_flavor (Resource)

Create a workload_flavor

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_workload_flavor" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the WorkloadFlavor. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the WorkloadFlavor will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `ephemeral_storage` (String) Ephemeral Storage (MiB). Ephemeral storage in MiB (mebibyte) allocated for the workload_flavor. ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.ranges: 1-6000
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `memory` (String) Memory (MiB). Memory in MiB (mebibyte) allocated for the workload_flavor. ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.ranges: 1-32768
- `vcpus` (Number) vCPUs. Number of vCPUs allocated for the workload_flavor. Each vCPU is a thread on a CPU core. ves.io.schema.rules.float.gte: 0.0 ves.io.schema.rules.float.lte: 8.0

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_workload_flavor.example system/example
```
